column4: So, who decided that ubuquity was too good for 640x480 res? ;)
this really sucks..  I can't get X to start at anything but 640x480@60hz
try Driver "vesa" to get going again
where?
This is the install CD..
in xorg.conf, under the Device subsection
d'oh that kinda sucks, what video card do you have?
should be an i830, I believe
just a hunch, try changing the driver to "i810", and then try "sudo /etc/init.d/restart gdm" at the command line and see if that helps
it detects the driver as i810
may leave you off worse than before, but worst case you will have to reboot
It's a 82845G/GL
then try "vesa" instead and see if restarting gdm helps
restarting gdm failed :p
it "stopped", but X is still running
make sure you have commented out any i810-specific options in the device section
ctrl-alt-backspace did the trick
So, why do new versions of X hate this card?
rather, when using i810
i dunno, but my HTPC uses an i915, so hopefully i'll have some useful tips when i start converting it to Ubuntu
